Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin : Arraignment and Detention Hearing as to Rafael Lara-Joglar (12) held on 11/21/2007. Defendant waived reading of the indictment. Plea of not guilty entered as to Counts 1-7, 11, 12. The parties are granted 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Aida Delgado-Colon for trial setting. As to detention, the government argued in favor of detention without bail. Defense counsel requested that the Court adopt the bail recommendations made by Pretrial Services and that half the bond amount recommended be unsecured. The Court granted the government's request for detention without bail, finding that the defense did not overcome the statutory presumptions and that the defendant is a danger to the community. (SAUSA Maritza Maldonado. Atty David Ramos-Pagan. PTS Mari Carmen Rios. INT Janis Palma. CR FTR. CD Jyoti Mehta.) (jm) (Entered: 11/26/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez :Detention Hearing as to Harold Beltran-Santiago held on 11/27/2007. AUSA Maritza Maldonado and defense counsel Angel Valencia were present. Counsel proffered that the sister and common law wife of the defendant were present in court. The employer, not present in court, speaks highly of the defendant and request a continuance to provide evidence to rebut. Defense counsel propose an unsecured bond with special release conditions of third party custodian and electronic monitoring device. The Government proffered that defendant has no steady employment, is active to drug use, has a violent past, is a convicted felon and request detention for risk of flight and danger. After hearing the  parties, the Court denied the motion for continuance, finds defendant to be a risk of flight and danger to the community. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. The Court will allow counsel to file a motion for reconsideration, if additional evidence was to arise. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, CI: Felix Toledo) (br) (Entered: 11/27/2007)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez :Appearing for the Government, Olga Castellon and for defendant, Victoria Ferrer. Defendant is present in Court.Arraignment and Detention Hearing as to Luis J. Correa- Figueroa (32) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,11,12 held on 1/8/2008. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of not guilty is entered as to all counts. Defense counsel is granted 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter for the filing of any motions. The case is referred to Judge Delgado for trial setting. As to detention, defense counsel is heard and states that defendant has family ties. Defendant has a home where he can move into in Toa Baja. Defendant is not a danger to the community or a risk of flight. Defendant has a mother father and brothers and also has a daughter. Counsel for the Government objects as to bail and states that defendant had been convicted previously and was on supervised released for weapons and concurs with the pretrial report and finds that defendant is a risk of flight as defendant has no domicile in the metropolitan area. The Court after hearing arguments of counsel makes ruling for the record and finds that defendant is a risk of flight and a danger to the community and orders that defendant be detain pending trial. Defense counsel states to the Court that she reserves the right to reopen bail. (Court Reporter FTR.) (mn) (Entered: 01/08/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Scott Anderson and for defendant, Carlos Vazquez- Alvarez. Defendant is present in Court and is (U/C).Arraignment and Bail Hearing as to Miguel A. Suarez-Resto (37) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,11,12 held on 4/25/2008. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and enters a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties are granted 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. The case is referred to Judge Aida Delgado-Colon for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel informs the Court that the pretrial report is not recommending bail, however defendant is a long resident of P.R., for exception of having lived for 6 months in Pennsylvania and 4 yrs.in Massachussetts. Defense counsel further states that he spoke to defendant's wife, mother and this morning with his aunt who is on the way to this court as to the issue of bail. Defendant is not a risk of flight and would like to reserve the right to request the reopening of this hearing. The Court after hearing counsel and taking into account the pretrial report, finds that defendant 1s a risk of flight and danger to the community and orders that defendant be detain pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR.) (mn) (Entered: 04/25/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Show Cause/Bail Violations Hearing as to Elizabeth Rivera-Diaz held on 1/26/2009. Arguments heard on behalf of defense counsel in regards to the motions filed by the USPO. (See Dockets #1061, 1137). Arguments in opposition heard on behalf of the government. Court will not revoke the conditions of release. However, the defendant is strongly admonished that should she incur in any further violations to her conditions of release, including testing positive to the use of controlled substances, an arrest warrant will be issued for her arrest and she will be placed under custody. The Court AMENDS the conditions of release as follows: The defendant is to be monitored with intensive drug testing, receive psychiatric and psychological evaluation. Due to the defendant's pregnancy, the Sentencing Hearing is continued Sine Die. USPO to notify the Court as soon as the baby is born, to set this hearing accordingly. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)  (Court Interpreter Annie Flores.) Hearing set for 3:00 p.m. Hearing held at 3:05 p.m. Hearing ended at 3:30 p.m. (sr) Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Guillermo Macari. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Angel Meaux. (Entered: 01/27/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Sentencing held on 3/12/2009 for Jorge A. Figueroa-Gonzalez (18). Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended PSR. PSR to be amended accordingly to the changes discussed and stated on the record. The parties' re-stipulated Statement of Facts will be made part of the record and will appear as an attachment to the original plea agreement signed by the parties. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment are heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Count(s) 1, Term of imprisonment: Seventy- seven (77) months as to Count One (1) and sixty (60) months as to Count Seven (7) to be served consecutively to each other, for a total of 137 months. SRT of 8 years as to Count One (1) and 5 years as to Count Seven (7), to be served concurrently with each other. No fine. SMA of $200.00.; Count(s) 11, 12, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, Dismissed. As informed by defense counsel, it's noted that the defendant's DNA was already collected as part of the conditions of the sentence imposed in CR. 07-0147. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) (Court Interpreter Felix Toledo.) Hearing set for 5:00 p.m. Hearing held at 4:44 p.m. Hearing ended at 6:06 p.m. (sr) Present: AUSA G. Andrew Massucco and defense counsel Laura Maldonado. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Manuel Casanova also present. (Entered: 03/13/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Andrew Massucco and for defendant, Jose Luis Barreto. Defendant is present in Court and is (U/C).Hearing on defendant's prose motion to appoint counsel docket # 1574 as to Ruben Sanchez-Reyes held on 3/23/2009. The Court states that this matter was referred to him because Judge Delgado is presently on trial. The Court makes inquiries to defendant and defendant is heard. Counsel for defendant and the government, are also heard. The Court after hearing defendant states that it seems that what defendant is trying to do is attempting to withdraw his plea and not change his atty. The Court doesn't see that a change of counsel should be granted. The Court will order an expedite transcript of the Change of Plea docket # 1218 held on February 6, 2009 to see if defendant's plea was voluntarily and then the Court will make a decision and will file a report and recommendation. The Court further states that it will recommend to the Court that the request for withdrawal of change of counsel be denied. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Edna Brayfield.)Hearing set for 02:00.Hearing held at 02:06.Hearing ended at 02:30. (mn) (Entered: 03/24/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Elizabeth Rivera-Diaz (42) held on 5/22/2015. Present were AUSA Edward G. Veronda and AFPD John Connors. USPO Norma Martinez also present. Defendant is U/C. Defense informs that they will not contest the allegations as so informed by the USPO. Defendant's allocution heard. Court finds that the defendant violated her conditions of SRT and the Sentence imposed on 9/18/09 is hereby revoked. The Court imposed an imprisonment time of 12 months and 1 day and SRT of 4 years with original conditions of release. In addition, conditions of supervision are modified to include more conditions. Defendant was advised as to his right to appeal. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)Hearing set for 11:00.Hearing held at 11:16.Hearing ended at 11:56.Interpreter Annie Flores. (su) (Entered: 05/26/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Elizabeth Rivera-Diaz (42) held on 11/18/2015. Present: AUSA Carlos Cardona and AFPD Laronda Martin. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Ivelisse Alonso also present. Counsel for defendant informs that defendant's mother Evelyn Diaz is present and her testimony is proffered to the Court. Argues there was a misunderstanding and the defendant did not mean to blatantly disregard and not comply with conditions of supervised release. Requests she be allowed to remain serving her SRT. USPO Ivelisse Alonso addresses the Court and states that defendant was indeed informed on 10/6/2015 that she had to report to the USPO, yet she failed to do so. Sidebar Conference held. Defendant's allocution heard.  Court finds basis to revoke, however, will afford the defendant one last opportunity. Defendant is strongly admonished that she must comply with all her conditions of SRT, should she not comply, she will be arrested and will remain under custody. Therefore, the electronic monitoring device is to be installed today. Defendant is to remain in home incarceration 24/7 for the next 3 days. The defendant or her mother, within the next 3 days, are to purchase a mobile phone to monitor the electronic device. Case will remain open and matter will be revisited on 12/7/2015. Further Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release set for 12/7/2015 at 2:00 PM in Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 3:00 p.m. Hearing held at 3:15 p.m. Hearing ended at 3:50 p.m.Interpreter Felix Toledo. (sr) (Entered: 11/18/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Further Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Elizabeth Rivera-Diaz (42) held on 12/7/2015. Present: AUSA Elba Gorbea, AFPD Laronda Martin, USPO Ivelisse Alonso. The Court informs that the defendant has been complying with the condition of reporting to USPO. In one occasion she claimed to have had an emergency and she was authorized to go to the Emergency Room that she would take and send pictures of the surrounding in order to verify that in deed she had gone there. Dependant seemed to have failed to comply with the instructions. Parties approach the bench with the defendants cellular and discover that the pictures had been in fact taken and sent, however, it seems that they had not been correctly delivered. The Court explains to the defendant that the next time she has a similar situation, she needs to verify that in fact the photos are delivered correctly. Ms. Martin informs that defendant needs medication and USPO informs that she has an appointment with the doctor this week. Case will remain open and matter will be revisited on 1/12/16.Further Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release set for 1/12/2016 02:00 PM in Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)Hearing set for 02:00.Hearing held at 02:11.Hearing ended at 02:23. Interpreter Tomas Kavelin. (su) (Entered: 12/08/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Jesus M. Agosto-Flores (47) held on 6/15/2016. Present: AUSA John Mathews, AFPD Lauren Rosen and PO Yvette Villegas Defendant was present in court and assisted by court interpreter Marie Hernandez. Waiver of preliminary hearing was filed. The Court after advising the defendant as to his rights, approved the waiver and found probable cause as to the allegations contained in the motion filed by the probation officer. Case referred to Chief Judge Delgado for Final Revocation Hearing. As to bail, defense counsel requested that defendant be released pending final revocation hearing. The government had no objection that defendant be released but requested that he be admitted in a substance abuse treatment program. The Court granted the request. Defendant, between now and the final revocation hearing date, shall be placed, temporarily, in a halfway house and he has to participate in a substance abuse treatment program. (Court Reporter DCR.)Hearing set for 02:00.Hearing held at 02:34.Hearing ended at 02:50. (ft) (Entered: 06/21/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Luis Villoda-Soto (33) held on 4/3/2017. Present: AUSA G. Andrew Massucco and AFPD Jesus Hernandez. Defendant present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Angel Meaux also present. AFPD Hernandez informed that they will not challenge the USPO's motion informing the violations. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Requested time served be imposed and defendant continue with his drug rehabilitation treatment, which has helped him. Government moved for an imprisonment term at the upper end of the guideline. Sidebar Conference held with attorneys of record and USPO Meaux. Counsel for defendant requested a 2 week continuance in order to afford parties to identify alternatives that will continue providing defendant with his current drug rehabilitation treatment. Being there no objection by the Government, the request is Granted. Medical records from MDC-Guaynabo (including current prescribed medications) to be provided to the parties. Parties to exhaust efforts and have identified source(s) of treatment for defendant. Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release set to continue on 4/24/2017 at 3:30 PM in Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 10:30 a.m. Hearing held at 10:50 a.m. Hearing ended at 11:12 a.m. Interpreter Janis Palma. (sr) (Entered: 04/04/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Luis J. Correa-Figueroa (32) held on 5/9/2017. Present: AUSA Vanessa Bonhomme and defense counsel Jason Gonzalez. Defendant present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Jeffrey Semidey also present. Sidebar Conference held. Defense informed they will not contest the allegations. Defendant is facing a life sentence in CR. 15-468 (PAD), hearing is set for 7/7/2017. Defendant's allocution heard. Requested term be imposed concurrently to the sentence to be imposed by Judge Delgado-Hernandez. Government moved for a term of 5 years. After hearing the parties, the SRT imposed on 8/6/2010 is revoked. IMPR: of five (5) years. No further SRT imposed. Any request for concurrency to be brought forth at the sentencing hearing. Defense counsel requested defendant remain at MDC-Guaynabo. Defendant also has CV. 16-2331 (ADC) pending before this Court. Request is Granted. US Marshals not to remove the defendant. Court will issue case management order in the civil case, case had been stayed pending defendant's trial in CR. 15-468 (PAD). (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) JUDGMENT of USCA (certified copy) as to Jesus Iglesias- Viera (1); Petitioner seeks leave to file a second or successive 28 U.S.C. § 2255 motion, through which he would challenge his 18 U.S.C. § 924(c) firearms conviction pursuant to Sessions v. Dimaya. Thus, petitioner has failed to make the prima facie showing necessary to garner relief. The application is DENIED. Thfis]... denial of an authorization... to file a second or successive application shall not be appealable and shall not be the subject of a petition for rehearing or for a writ of certiorari. (x1) (Entered: 08/23/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Juan Rivera-Ocasio (19) held on 3/18/2019. Present were AUSA Scott Anderson, AFPD Victor Miranda, and USPO Guillermo Arbona. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. AFPD Miranda stated that the defendant accepted the allegations contained in the Motion filed by the USPO at Docket 3357 . Statements in support of mitigation of punishment were heard on behalf of the defense. The defendant's allocution and the Government's statements were also heard. After having heard the parties, the Court revoked the SRT and imposed sentence as follows: IMPR: Eleven (11) months. SRT: Six (6) years, under the same conditions initially imposed. The defendant was advised of his right to appeal. The defense objected to the sentence imposed as objectively and substantively unreasonable. Objection noted. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 02:20.Hearing ended at 02:28 Interpreter Virginia Santamaria. (lod) (Entered: 03/19/2019)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Case called for Preliminary Revocation Hearing but a Show Cause Hearing was held instead as to Noes Soto- Vazquez (22) on 2/28/2020. Present were AUSA Jose Contreras, Attorney Linda Backiel and USPO Joseline Perez. The defendant was under custody, present in court and did not require the services of the Court Interpreter. ECF No. 3474 MOTION Notifying Violations of SRT and ECF No. 3482 Supplemental Motion where discussed in open court. The Government informed that they are not going forward with the all the allegations contained in ECF No. 3474 only with the allegation as to Standard Condition No. 6. The Government also stated that they are going forward with all the allegations contained in ECF No. 3482 . Defense counsel requested that the defendant remain under the same conditions of supervised release previously imposed pending the final revocation hearing. The Government did not oppose since the US Probation Office is recommending that the defendant be released. After having heard the parties, the Court ordered the defendant released under same conditions of supervised release pending the final revocation hearing. The Court informed that there is no need to hold a Preliminary Revocation Hearing pursuant to Rule 32.1 since the defendant will be released. The case is referred to Aida M. Delgado-Colon, U.S. District Judge for the Final Revocation Hearing. Sidebar held with defense counsel and the Government. (Court Reporter DCR / Courtroom 8.) Hearing set for 10:00. Hearing held at 10:37. Hearing ended at 10:47. Interpreter Ani Navarro. (ram) Modified on 2/28/2020 to edit docket text (rom). (Entered: 02/28/2020)
ORDER Noted re 3477 Informative Motion as to Noes Soto-Vazquez (22). Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 3/3/2020. (sr) (Entered: 03/03/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Ariazer Toro-Santiago (25) held on 8/10/2020 by VTC. Present: AUSA Sean Murphy and AFPD Eleonora Marranzini. Defendant present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Desiree Reyes also present. The findings under the CARES Act should reflect that given the exigent circumstances created by the COVID pandemic and the Declaration of Emergency by the State and Federal Government, this hearing is being conducted by VTC in order to ensure the rights of the defendant, his eligibility for programs subsequent to sentencing, which will turn to his benefit, and the health of all the parties involved. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense, requested 8 months be imposed concurrent with the sentence imposed in CR. 19-729-01 (ADC). Defendant's allocution heard. Government moved that SRT be revoked and an imprisonment term of 8 months be imposed and to be served consecutively to the 46 months in CR. 19-729. SRT revoked and imprisonment term of 14 months imposed to be served consecutively to the 46 months imposed in CR. 19-729-01 (ADC). No further SRT imposed. Defense objected to the imprisonment term imposed. Objection on the record. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Hearing set for 2:30 p.m. Hearing held at 3:00 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:00 p.m. Interpreter Mayra Cardona. (sr) (Entered: 08/10/2020)

The defendant was advised of the SRT violations alleged in the Motion filed by USPO Carpena at Docket No. 3507 . The defendant was also advised of his rights, including his right to a preliminary hearing. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, the Court confirmed the United States obligation to produce all exculpatory evidence to the defendant pursuant to Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny, and ordered it to do so. Failing to do so in a timely manner may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings or sanctions by the Court. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan: Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Julio A. Nunez- Castro (44) held on 12/4/2020. Present: AUSA Jenifer Hernandez and AFPD Ellie Marranzini. The defendant was present, under custody at Bayamon 705 and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC. The defendant was advised of the SRT violations alleged in the Motion filed by USPO Maldonado at Docket No. 3491 . The defendant was also advised of his rights, including his right to a preliminary hearing. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. Pursuant to the  Due Process Protections Act, the Court confirmed the United States obligation to produce all exculpatory evidence to the defendant pursuant to Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny, and ordered it to do so. Failing to do so in a timely manner may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings or sanctions by the Court. APFD Marranzini moved for conditions of release. The Government requested temporary detention until the matter could be addressed with input from USPO at the preliminary hearing. After having heard the parties, the Court denied the defense's motion without prejudice and ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. AFPD Marranzini also requested disclosure of evidence pertaining to the allegations in USPO's motion. The Court instructed defense counsel to file a motion directing such request to the Presiding Judge. A Notice to Bayamon 705 regarding the defendant's medical conditions shall be issued. Preliminary Revocation Hearing set for 12/15/2020 10:00 AM in VTC Bridge MDM before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan. The Government is reminded that an interpreter must be provided if any of its witnesses cannot testify in the English Language. USPO is ordered to be present at the hearing and come prepared with all the information concerning the underlying state charges. (Court Reporter Evilys Carrion.)Hearing set for 10:45.Hearing held at 10:54.Hearing ended at 11:07.Interpreter Felix Toledo. (lod) (Entered: 12/09/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance / Show Cause Hearing as to Noes Soto-Vazquez (22) held on 12/17/2020. AUSA Jose Contreras, counsel Linda Backiel and USPO Joseline Perez were present. Defendant was under supervised release, present and did not required the services of the  court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. Defendant voluntarily consented to the holding of the hearing via VTC. Defense counsel explained the reasons why the defendant did not appear before the court during the previous hearing. She further explained that defendant was uncommunicated and outside counsel's office waiting while the previous hearing was being conducted. Counsel Linda Backiel also informed that she is appearing pro bono on behalf of the defendant. As to the matter of detention, the government requested that the defendant be detained. Defense counsel argued for conditions of release. The court granted conditions of release by adding home incarceration and electronic monitoring to defendant's supervised release conditions. The Court also ordered the defendant to install a landline, to reside in Bayamon at his address of record, defendant is not allowed to work, defendant may submit medical evidence consisting of a physician's certification that the use of marihuana is the only treatment available for his medical conditions so the USPO can evaluate such evidence, defendant shall not use medical marihuana and shall not make use of his medical marihuana license if there is one. Furthermore, the arrest warrant issued at ECF No. 3622 is hereby quashed and the electronic monitoring shall be installed tomorrow at the latest. The case is referred to Judge Aida Delgado Colon for the scheduling of a final revocation hearing. (Court Reporter Cindy Brown.) Hearing set for 01:45. Hearing held at 01:47. Hearing ended at 03:14. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Julio A. Nunez-Castro (44) held on 1/22/2021. Present: AUSA Jenifer Hernandez, AFPD Isabel Mattina and USPO Helga Maldonado. The defendant was present, under custody at Bayamon 705 and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC. The parties informed the Court of the dismissal of the state case. The defense objected to the testimony of USPO Maldonado if it would be based on documents from the state case which were all in Spanish, and also for lack of personal knowledge about the events that led to the filing of state charges. The objection was noted but overruled as premature. The testimonies of USPO Maldonado and Yahaira Ruiz-Ocasio were heard on behalf of the Government. AUSA Hernandez and AFPD Mattina argued as to the issue of probable cause. After having heard the testimonies of the witnesses and the arguments from both parties, the Court found probable cause as to the violation included in the motion filed by USPO at Docket

The case was referred to U.S. District Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon for Final Revocation Hearing. The defendant shall remain detained pending further proceedings. Evidence admitted: Government's Exhibit 1. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release to be set by the Presiding Judge. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Luis M. Fernandez-Quinones (20) held on 4/14/2021 by VTC. Present: AUSA Marc Chattah and AFPD Andrew McCutcheon. Defendant present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Luis Carpena also present. The findings under the CARES Act should reflect that given the exigent circumstances created by the COVID pandemic and the Declaration of Emergency by the State and Federal Government, this hearing is being conducted by VTC in order to ensure the rights of the defendant, his eligibility for programs subsequent to revocation, which will turn to his benefit, and the health of all the parties involved. Defense informed that the parties have agreed that the only violations to be pursued by the Government are the ones contained in Motion filed at ECF 3507 . Therefore, the defendant will not contest the violations, and requested time served. Defendant's allocution heard. Government requested an imprisonment term of 9 months. SRT revoked. IMPR: 8 months and SRT of 5 years. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Hearing set for 10:00 a.m. Hearing held at 10:05 a.m. Hearing ended at 10:25 a.m. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (sr) (Entered: 04/14/2021)
JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Luis M. Fernandez-Quinones (20). IMPR: 8 months and SRT of 5 years. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 4/14/2021 .(sr) (Entered: 04/14/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Julio A. Nunez-Castro (44) held on 4/14/2021 by VTC. Present: AUSA Jenifer Hernandez and AFPD Isabel Mattina. Defendant present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Helga Maldonado also present. The findings under the CARES Act should reflect that given the exigent circumstances created by the COVID pandemic and the Declaration of Emergency by the State and Federal Government, this hearing is being conducted by VTC in order to ensure the rights of the defendant, his eligibility for programs subsequent to revocation, which will turn to his benefit, and the health of all the parties involved. Defense informed they will not contest the violation, as so informed by the USPO and requested time served be imposed. Defendant's allocution heard. Government objected and proceeded by proffer as to nature and seriousness of the offense, which triggered the violation of his SRT. Requested 3 years of imprisonment and further SRT. Defense arguments in opposition heard. After hearing the parties, the Court revoked SRT. IMPR: 3 years and SRT of 4 years. Government's Exhibits 1-11 admitted. Defendant's Exhibits A-C admitted. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Hearing set for 3:30 p.m. Hearing set for 4:15 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:45 p.m. Interpreter Tom Kavelin. (sr) (Entered: 04/14/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Juan Rivera-Ocasio (19) held on 5/20/2021 by VTC. Present: AUSA Seth Erbe and AFPD Ivan Santos. Defendant present, under SRT conditions, and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Desiree Reyes also present. The findings under the CARES Act should reflect that given the exigent circumstances created by the COVID pandemic and the Declaration of Emergency by the State and Federal Government, this hearing is being conducted by VTC in order to ensure the rights of the defendant, his eligibility for programs subsequent to revocation, which will turn to his benefit, and the health of all the parties involved. Defense informed they will not contest the violations, as so notified by the Supervising US Probation Officer. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Government requested an imprisonment term be imposed. After further discussing the case with attorneys of record and the USPO, the Court revoked the SRT and imposed an imprisonment term of 3 months. SRT of 4 years. Defense requested defendant be allowed to voluntary surrender tomorrow. Request Granted. By noon tomorrow, 5/21/2021, defendant to voluntary surrender to the Office of the US Marshals of this District. As to defense counsel's concern as to his medications, defendant is to provide the US Marshals with a list of the current medications he is taking for them to relay said information to BOP medical staff. (Court Reporter Rachelle Robinson Ware.) Hearing set for 1:00 p.m. Hearing held at 1:00 p.m. Hearing ended at 1:45 p.m. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (sr) (Entered: 05/20/2021)
